Package cards.action_cards

Class CollectFromPlayer

java.lang.Object
cards.Card
cards.ActionCard
cards.action_cards.CollectFromPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
MachineRandom
Direct Known Subclasses:
FileALawsuit, ItsYourBirthday
public abstract class CollectFromPlayer
extends ActionCard
implements MachineRandom
Abstract class providing a skeletal implementation of an action card that asks the player to collect money from another player

Since all such action cards require the amount to be randomly generated at the start of the game, this abstract class implements the method in the interface MachineRandom

.

  • Constructor Details

    • CollectFromPlayer

      public CollectFromPlayer​(java.lang.String name, int amountLB, int amountUB, int increment)
      Constructor with the specified name, lower bound and upper bound, and increment for the possible amount of money to be collected from another player as parameters

      The name of an action card that asks the player to collect money from another player is indicative of the action it specifies: File a Lawsuit, It's Your Birthday.

      Parameters:
      name - name of this card
      amountLB - lower bound for the possible amount of money to be collected from another player
      amountUB - upper bound for the possible amount of money to be collected from another player
      increment - increment for the possible amount of money to be collected from another player

    • getMachineRandNum

      public int getMachineRandNum()
      Returns a randomly generated value within the lower and upper bounds of the possible amount (inclusive) and following the specified increment using the Java ThreadLocalRandom utility class

      A separate (private) function sets the amount collected from another player to the returned randomly generated value.

      Technically, the number is generated in a pseudorandom fashion, which is adequate for the purposes of the game.

      Specified by:
      getMachineRandNum in interface MachineRandom
      Returns:
      Randomly generated value within the lower and upper bounds of the possible amount (inclusive) and following the specified increment

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this card, which includes its name and its description as an action card that asks a player to collect money from another player

      In particular, the representation contains the following details:

      • Type of card (Action card)
      • Name of the card (for example, File a Lawsuit, It's Your Birthday)
      • The header "Amount Collected from Other Player" (which is a general description of the Collect from Player category of action cards)
      Overrides:
      toString in class ActionCard
      Returns:
      string representation of this card
